answers.answer: Hello...I'm 27 weeks with a baby boy who attached real low...so I have been having extreme pelvic pain/bladder pressure...not fun!My DD was real high and while that was uncomfortable in my rib cage...this push so much pressure down below there are times when I have trouble walking.I worked up until the day I had DD....infact I went to work in the early stages of labor.Her pregnancy was pure joy though...this one...I don't know how I'll make it until my due date but for my planned leave....I need to.

Hello ladies!  I'm 29 weeks.  My son is also extremely low.  I had my last appt on Monday and he said that my little guy will be here middle of September, a couple of weeks early.  I'm so excited, but that means about 2 months left or a little less.  I'm so not ready.  But I'm ready for all this pressure to be gone!  I feel like he's gonna fall right out sometimes.

Hey ladies I'm 29wks too. Although I will be having my DD early,1st/2nd wk sept.  I go through times of being scared, excited and in a rush to get this little one out of my stomach!! My DD is EVERYWHERE. One minute I'll get a punch in my bladder and next I'll get a kick in my ribs or upper stomach. She's hyper I guess.... lol... I hope this isn't a bad sign of what's to come for me when she gets here!! I really think it's awful some of you ladies don't get maternity leave. Over all how are you ladies feeling?

Hi Guys, I am in my 26th week and I think my baby girl is low too as I get those nasty pelvic pains and when I have to go, it hits me very hard and fast. Last night she was kicking me so hard I felt ike she was coming out of me. I have an app't on Monday and hopefully will ahve another U/S.I can't beleive I have 3 mos to go still.

Well I'm not working.  I had a subchorionic bleed the didn't resolve itself until 14 weeks, then I had a LEEP done 3 years ago and had to have my cervix monitored.  When I finally got the okay to go back to work no one wants to hire me.  So, I'm just hanging out waiting for this little guy to be born so I can start working again.  I'm going nuts here!
Sorry, I don't know why that posted twice:S

Well I'm not working.  I had a subchorionic bleed the didn't resolve itself until 14 weeks, then I had a LEEP done 3 years ago and had to have my cervix monitored.  When I finally got the okay to go back to work no one wants to hire me.  So, I'm just hanging out waiting for this little guy to be born so I can start working again.  I'm going nuts here!

I'm almost 26 weeks. I'm feeling good. I'm carrying her low. With my other DD I don't remember carrying her low at all until the end. No pain, hopefully it stays that way. My uterus and her are measuring bigger so I will have her probably a week earlier. It'll be a scheduled csection due to pelvis being too small. So more than likely I will have her on the 23th or 24th of October, they haven't scheduled it yet.        I didn't breastfeed my other DD and this time I want to so hopefully that goes well. I'm looking forward to it.

29 weeks here. failed my gestational diabetes test. ugh. going for the 3 hour next week. babies are all over the place. last night my poor s/o was telling them to stop trying to bust out, it isn't time yet!i have mild early preeclampsia and am a bed rest disobeying girlie. i was told to work four hours a day, which is less than my std would pay out and not quite enough to function on. ugh. good news is i got a raise yesterday. next doctor visit is the 26th. i plan to get full bed rest then.one baby is low, the other is sitting higher and to the right. my belly looks hilarious! they are already fighting in the womb. go figure. my doctors all call them "wild" or "hyper"geesh...is it October 3rd yet?

Almost 26 weeks here.  Doing really well.  Baby girl likes to use my bladder a pillow and I will likely be the one in diapers before she gets here.  Had my check-up this past Monday, all is well.  Belly is meauring 26 inches, doc says that right on target.  Hubby and I are leaving tomorrow on a much needed vacation - 8 days in the Carribean should do the trick! :-)  October 28th can't get here soon enough - I am just dying to know what she looks like.  I'm not having a 3d/4d done...I want to be surprised I guess.  Since I found out the sex, I figure I need at least that one surprise of knowing what she looks like.  We'll see if I can hold out.  Glad all you ladies are doing well also!  Sounds like we are all just hanging in there!  I am greatful everyday for my precious angel and know you all are too!

I'm having a hard time sleeping at night lately.  I wake up to use the bathroom (of course) and then can't fall back to sleep.  There is so much going on right now (we're moving cross country next month, can't sell our house, have just written a contract on our third house where we're headed-the other two fell apart, DD is starting K in August and we still don't know what school she's going to, I've been waiting to hear about a job for a month now, and-oh yeah- a BABY is on its way!!!!!!)  I can't believe I'm in the 30th week already!  A couple days ago I had a baby-body part lodged almost right under my sternum.  It hurt!  I felt bad, but I had to gently push it back down...so weird!  I kept trying to figure out what it was-almost felt round, like the head.  Last night as I lay in bed, unable to sleep, the baby was VERY active!  I kept picturing the dancing baby from Ally McBeal-it was all over the place all at once.  The good news is my BP is good, I passed the glucose test, measurements are good, and my stretching ligaments are hurting less!

25 weeks here. SO HUNGRY all the time. She is kicking like crazy, loves my trampoline bladder. Im glad Im not the only one feeling this. Friends are telling me I am starting to waddle instead of walk. Lovely. Went to our first birth class last night which was cool. Two moms with sets of twins on the way, pretty neat. Saw all sorts of gruesome videos on c sections and breech births, ect. Here we go.....Its hard to believe I am going to get bigger than I am now. The u/s said she is in the 85th percentile and weighs 2lbs. Is that big or normal? My DH and I are both six feet tall so I assume she will be carrying along the basketball torch :)

My DD measures perfect length, but has always been about 2wks ahead of average in weight. I think at 24wks my dd weighed over 1lb1/2. Then at 28wks She already weighed 3lbs.... she put on quite a bit in 4wks... doubled her weight!! My doctors and nurses guess that at 36wks when they deliver her she will already be over 7lbs. and if I went full term well over 9lbs!! Thankfully I'm not going full term. It's nothing to be concerned about... You will just have a big baby!! Congrats!
My due-date is also the 28th of October i know how u feel.. Baby is good not sure what it is but looking forward to it being here.. October is sooo far away:)

Hi ladies I am 27 weeks along with my third child, supposed to be a boy we shall see! He is very active and likes to hang out very high. I am not sure what body part it is but when I stand for more than 30 mins he moves to the right side under my ribs and he pushes so hard! It feels like my stomach is on fire and no matter how much I rub I can't seem to move him unless I lay down for awhile! I'm not sure why this is?? I also have an extremely active baby. He moves so much it wakes me up! Besides the fact I feel like I should just move my bed into the bathroom ;) I've been on and off bed rest since around 14 weeks for placenta Previa and preterm labor so I am just hoping these are all good signs.. I have to admit though since my last child is almost 8 it feels like I can't remember anything about pregnancy! I am not even sure what contractions are supposed to feel like. I am hoping it will all come back to me when the time is right.. lol! I hope all is well with all of you and your babies! BTW anyone else have yet to gain any weight? I am hungry all the time! I finally stop losing weight but I can't seem to put any one? Maybe it is because I am a bigger girl to start with??

I too know exactly what you mean I have an 8 year old son, and this little guy in my tummy! Its strange remebering all these things that I had forgot.  My little guy to is very active hangs out in my left side under my ribs (just like my son jayden did) I am always in the bathroom! As soon as I stand up its like "run to the bathroom hurry" the pressure is intense.  I find myself working all day, (at a sit down desk job) getting extremely uncomfortable, and when I get home I am still uncomfortable! Last night I laid down at 700pm and got back up at 1100am but I felt refreshed and rested, this is definatley taking a toll on me! So I am glad to know other Mommies are feeling this way too! Take Care

Hi everyone.  I'm in my 26th week. Don't know the gender but he/she sometimes feels like they are going to bust right out of me.  It's a show at night watching the flips and flops in my belly.  I'm having difficulty getting comfortable at night.  I lay on my left side which is suggested but I think I need more pillows!!  My appetite has oddly decreased a little compared to last month when I was eating every second possible.  Anyway...I am really looking forward to meeting this little one and all of these annoying bodily issues are worth it  : )  Don't you agree!

Well, I was an October mommy but I am looking more at September now.  26.5 weeks here and its a boy- everyone told me it was a girl, heck I thought that it was a girl... surprise!  Anyway, he is measuring ahead of schedule and already weighs over 3 lbs, which is good since he will be born early- hopefully that will shorten our time in NICU.

Hi all!  I am in my 26th week. My ds is 11! So I can relate to how it feels as if we are learning it all over again!! I go for my guestational diabetes test this week! They did not do that one 11 years ago just a blood test! How bad is the sugary drink? My son was high but is now very low, lots of bladder pressure also!  Take Care!

question: Hello October Mommies! I am just wondering how all of you are doing! I am in week 28! I am feeling it too, its getting harder the pressure from my baby boy on my bladder. He likes to hang out in my ribs just like my first son did! I am working all the way up to delivery, are there any mom's out there doing this? I am asking since I do NOT get materntiy leave.  Any suggestions on how to get through this up to delivery? Thanks
title: October Mommies
